intro: Platythelys platensis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to purple flowers. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it an invasive species in some regions.
